meanings.definition: Provide with a clue or clues.
meanings.sent1: She was clueing her friend about the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: The detective was clueing in the team about the new evidence.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was clueing the dog to where the treats were hidden.
meanings.sent4: The map was clueing the travelers towards the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was clueing the students on how to solve the tricky puzzle.

meanings.sent1: He was clueing his sister about the secret location of the key.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast was clueing us in on the upcoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious note was clueing the protagonist to the next clue.
meanings.sent4: The subtle smile on her face was clueing us to her excitement.
meanings.sent5: The old photograph was clueing them into the family's history.
